result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius J Redd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CT466 and #15CF294 called at 10:09am. 
Defendant Darius Jaquan Redd in court with Attorney Whitney DeVoe.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #15CT466-Count #1 and on Case #15CF294-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining counts [Case #15CT466-Counts #2 and #3, and Case #15CF294-Count #2].
--------------------------------------------

On Case #15CT466-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Redd:
--To serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--To pay fine of $600  + costs= [clerk's calculation: $1,744 plus $56.74 in blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office= $1,800.74]. The Court allows for a payment plan. The amount is to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing in June and in each month thereafter until paid in full.  The Court indicates that it is not setting a specific day of the month for payment, however the month's payment must be received by the last day of the month [the clerk lists a due date of 6/30/18 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full on the payment-slip].  Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment.
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim impact panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period 
--6 demerit points assessed
--------------------------------------------------
On Case #15CF294-Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Redd on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming, or a combination of these, as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

The Court designates that the Judgment of Conviction is to include language that indicates that the Court would not be opposed to the Department of Corrections filing a petition for early discharge from Probation if Mr. Redd has done well on Probation and complied with all of the Probation conditions.  

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $518] The Court allows for the same payment plan as set in Case #15CT466. Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment.
Days credit for time already served: 0  days

The Court allows counsel to submit a stipulation on days credit; this is to be filed within ten days.
Felony firearm and voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 10:30am
Bond Payment Information
scheduling
Jury trial on March 12, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on March 6, 2018 at 9:30 a.m. (rescheduled from 9:00 a.m. due to a calendar conflict)
Surety Information

As to Both Cases 15CF294 & 15CT466


Original Bond Document received from JESO on 1/8/18

records.addlTxt: Attorney Hagemann
The Court finds that the State has made a speedy trial demand as of this date.
This Bond applies to both Case #15CF294 and #15CT466.  The $1,000 Cash Bond requirement is separate from the $350 Cash Bond amount that was previously posted in Case #15CF294.

[MK] cases #15CF294 and #15CT468 called at 1:49pm. 
Defendant Darius J Redd appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Attorney De La Rosa acknowledges service of Complaints, though these cases are post-initial appearance/arraignment.
Attorney De La Rosa provides an updated address for Mr. Redd:  4977 N. 84th Street, Unit #10, Milwaukee WI 53225.
The Court finds that the State has requested a speedy trial. 

The Court requires a $1,000 Cash Bond to cover both files, with the same non-monetary conditions as previously ordered.  The Court clarifies that this amount is separate from the $350 Cash Bond that was previously posted.
recess 1:59 pm. 


NEXT: (1) FSSC on both cases on 3/9/18 at 9:00am--JA, note in comments that speedy trial time limits are in effect,  (2) Jury Trial on 3/12/18 at 8:30am

[MK] case called at 11;04am.
Attorney John V Rhiel in court.  ADA Jeffrey M Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial later this month.
Attorney Rhiel indicates he has lost touch with Mr. Redd in the past month, and that he does not have information on why Mr. Redd does not appear. 
The Court learns that there is a warrant pending for Mr. Redd in relation to a SCRAM-violation notice [Case #16CT466].
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant-body only; the Warrant is to indicate that upon arrest Mr. Redd is to be brought before Branch IV to appear.  
recess 11:08am.

Cases 15CF294 & 15CT466 called at 1:24 pm  [sf]
Defendant Darius J Redd in ccustody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office, on behalf of Attorney Rhiel. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

15CT466:
Court reviews procedural posture of case
Address and DOB information verified. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Attorney Flint advises the court that there is an amended complaint that was field today.
Service of Amended Criminal Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

On 15CT466:
Court requires $1500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-Not to drive without a valid drivers license
- The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.    **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

On 15CF294:
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $350 CASH bond, with previous non-monetary conditions.

Recess: 1:33 pm

Case called at 1:32pm [mo]
Defendant Darius J Redd appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that Mr. Redd is eligible for PD representation
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Redd indicates that his address is in Waukesha not Madison
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--not to drive without a valid driver's license
